private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks: A, E, I, O.
I can only pick or place blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can manipulate one block at a time and cannot move multiple blocks in a single action.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N.
I can only pick or place blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can manipulate one block at a time and cannot move multiple blocks in a single action.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, M is on N, N is on O, and O is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver to achieve the block-stack goal.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial stacks (from table upward): Stack1 = G, F, L, A, D, H, N, C, J; Stack2 = M, K, B, E; Stack3 = I, O.
Only the top block of any stack can be picked up or placed by an agent.
Agents can move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to interact only with vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I, O) and the other only with consonant-labelled blocks.
The final goal is a single stack with O on the table and the blocks above it in order N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A (A on top).

report.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent, an expert at analyzing blockworld move feasibility under your constraints. You will examine the public information and your private information and produce a concise report listing which vowel blocks are currently top-accessible, what legal pick/place operations you can perform on those vowel blocks, and any ordering or blocking constraints you observe relevant to vowel-handling. Do not emit PDDL; produce structured observations and suggested local moves only. Use the public information placeholder {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} in your reasoning.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a concise structured report of top-accessible vowel blocks, feasible local moves for each, and any blocking relationships affecting vowels.

report.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent, an expert at analyzing blockworld move feasibility under your constraints. You will examine the public information and your private information and produce a concise report listing which consonant blocks are currently top-accessible, what legal pick/place operations you can perform on those consonant blocks, and any ordering or blocking constraints you observe relevant to consonant-handling. Do not emit PDDL; produce structured observations and suggested local moves only. Use the public information placeholder {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} in your reasoning.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a concise structured report of top-accessible consonant blocks, feasible local moves for each, and any blocking relationships affecting consonants.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator, an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL for FastDownwards. You will receive the two agents' reports and must integrate them into a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models agents as separate actors if needed and preserves the constraint that vowel_agent can only move vowels and consonant_agent only consonants. Keep actions distinct for each agent where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility in types, predicates, actions, initial state, and goal.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the vowel agent report: {report_vowel}. Here is the consonant agent report: {report_consonant}. Integrate these inputs and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards, enclosing the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Ensure agent actions remain distinct and that top-of-stack and single-block movement constraints are represented.
